里.definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m; neighborhood; ancient administrative unit of 25 families; (Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

里人.definition: person from the same village, town or province; peasant (derog.); (of a school of thought etc) follower

里克特.definition: Richter (name); Charles Francis Richter (1900-1985), US physicist and seismologist, after whom the Richter scale is named

里希特霍芬.definition: Ferdinand von Richthofen (1833-1905), German geologist and explorer who published a major foundational study of the geology of China in 1887 and first introduced the term Silk Road 絲綢之路|丝绸之路

里弄.definition: lanes and alleys; neighborhood; lane neighborhoods in parts of Shanghai, with modified Chinese courtyard houses, occupied by single families in the 1930s, now crowded with multiple families

里昂.definition: Lyon, French city on the Rhône

里港.definition: Likang township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan

里港鄉.definition: Likang township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan

里瓦幾亞條約.pinyin: Li3 wa3 ji1 ya4 Tiao2 yue1
里瓦幾亞條約.definition: Treaty of Livadia (1879) between Russia and China, relating to territory in Chinese Turkistan, renegotiated in 1881 (Treaty of St. Petersburg)

里社.definition: village shrine to the earth god

里約.definition: agreement between the residents of a 里[li3], an administrative district under a city or town (Tw)

里賈納.definition: Regina city, capital of Saskatchewan province, Canada
